column4: Sorry for saying this twice, but if I want to restart gnome without restarting my computer, how do I do?
sudo invoke-rc.d gdm restart
just install xubuntu-desktop
cafuego: ok. :)
where do i find xubuntu-desktop using synaptic? could not generate any results with search words: xubuntu-desktop and xubuntu.
maybe it's only available for breezy then
most likely.
would a upgrade to breezy be easily done without having to remove any of my current information?
I see "500 http://archive.ubuntu.com breezy/universe Packages" - so it's in 'universe' for breezy.
it's quite a lot to download.
oh, ok, i'll try add that to respitories instead.
I'm pretty sure that xubuntu-desktop is just an empty meta-package anyway.
what does that mean?

just install these, and you'll have the same effect: abiword, acpi, acpi-support, acpid, anacron, apmd, bc, bogofilter, cdparanoia, cdrecord, cupsys, cupsys-bsd, cupsys-client, cupsys-driver-gimpprint, dbus-1-utils, dc, doc-debian, dvd+rw-tools, esound, fetchmail, firefox, foomatic-db, foomatic-db-engine, foomatic-db-gimp-print, foomatic-db-hpijs, foomatic-filters, foomatic-filters-ppds, gaim, gqview, graveman, gs-esp, hal, hotkey-setup, hplip-base
that's the list of packages that xubuntu-desktop brings in
well... i need xfce. :)
so, xfce or xfce4?
xfce4 is the newer of the two
I'd go for that if I was you
ok
thx m8.
